post.author: 박재홍
post.content:
Demonstration / protest is planned for tomorrow (June 30) by various groups opposed to the "occupation" of Iraq and the related change over to the Iraqi Government.  This protest is planned to begin around 2:00 p.m. and extend to 6:00 p.m. or beyond. There may also be attempts to disrupt rush hour traffic as people begin to leave their offices in preparation of the Canada Day holiday.

AGENDA:   (please note that the order of rally points and parade march times may change):

2 pm - Meet at King and Bay Streets, picket "Interhealth" @ 357 Bay
2 pm - Mass Delegation at @ 151 Yonge Street, picket.  It is believed that this will include attempts to picket U.S. firms,located in the area, that are participating in the re-building of Iraq including Rockwell and General Electric.

4 pm - Student Takeover @ College & University Ave:
The groups on Bay and Yonge streets are expected to move west along multiple paths in order to assemble at or near College & University.  It is the intention of the group to block all traffic at the intersection so as to generate commuter frustration on the eve of the July 1 holiday.

5 pm - Rally at US Consulate (@ 360 University Ave)
They will then move south to the USA Consulate to hold a rally, which is again expected to significantly affect traffic in the area.

6 pm - March through downtown core (financial district)
A parade march will then take place, for which a permit has been given. The parade route is expected to be north along University onto Dundas Street; east across Dundas to Yonge Street; south on Yonge Street to Queen Street; west on Queen Street back to University Avenue; then back to the USA Consulate.
post.title: Avoid downtown on June 30
